questions.text: All of the following statements are true about the following machine except:

options.label: A
options.text: The first stage pressure reducing valve reduces the pressure to 50- 60 psi

options.label: B
options.text: The second stage pressure reducing valve reduces the pressure to 15-30 psi

options.label: C
options.text: Emergency oxygen flush delivers 35 liters of oxygen at a pressure of 60 psi.

options.label: D
options.text: The diameter index safety system is to prevent the wrong fitting of cylinders to the anesthesia machine

questions.correct_answer: D. The diameter index safety system is to prevent the wrong fitting of cylinders to the anesthesia machine
questions.explanation:
Solution:

The diameter index safety system is to prevent the wrong fitting of cylinders to the anesthesia machine A diameter index safety system (DISS) is used to prevent the wrong fitting of central supply pipes to the As the name suggests, there is a different diameter of different pipes to fit into the coupler of that specific gas.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A - First stage pressure reducing valves (also called pressure preset valve) reduces the pressure from high pressures of oxygen (2,000 psi) and nitrous oxide (760 psi) to 50-60 psi Option B - Newer machines have two pressure-reducing valves the second one reducing the pressure further to 15-30 psi. Option C- Emergency oxygen flush is a special provision in anesthesia machines to deliver high flows (35 liters) of 100% oxygen at a high pressure of 50-60 psi. As such high flows and pressures can cause barotrauma therefore oxygen flush should be used only during severe emergencies.

questions.text: The significance of the following part of anesthesia machine is:

options.label: A
options.text: It ensures that the wrong gas is not delivered to the patient

options.label: B
options.text: It ensures that high pressure is not delivered to the patient

options.label: D
options.text: It prevents the leakage of gases

questions.correct_answer: A. It ensures that the wrong gas is not delivered to the patient
questions.explanation:
Solution:

It ensures that the wrong gas is not delivered to the patient The pin index system is a very important safety mechanism to prevent the wrong fitting of cylinders at other’s positions . It consists of 2 pins, 4 mm and 6 mm long on the yoke of the anesthesia The pins are so positioned that the cylinder with the holes at the corresponding distance can only be fitted at that position. 7 pin positions corresponding to the same position of holes on the cylinder has been described. For example- The pins at the yoke of oxygen are at 2 and 5 positions. Oxygen cylinders have holes at the same position making only oxygen cylinders possible to be placed at this position. Similarly yoke of nitrous oxide has pins positioned at the 3, and 5 positions; the nitrous oxide cylinder has holes at the same position making it the only nitrous oxide cylinder possible to be placed in this position.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option B - To prevent the delivery of high pressures, all modern anesthesia machines have 2 pressure-reducing valves. The first one ( shown as 1 and 2 in diagram) reduces the pressure to 50-60 PSI and the second one (shown as 3 and 4 in diagram) to 15-30 PSI. Option C - To prevent static current, the equipment coming in contact with the patient (like a face mask) or coming in contact with the floor (like OT shoes, tyres of the trolley) are made antistatic by adding carbon to them. Option D - A washer is placed between the cylinder and the machine to minimize the chances of leakage.

Extraedge:

Pin index position for other gases Cyclopropane- 3, 6 Air- 1, 5 Nitrogen- 1, 4 Entonox- 7 Carbon dioxide- (< 7.5%) 2, 6 Heliox- 2, 4

questions.text: False about gas flow principles through the following equipment:

options.label: A
options.text: At low flows, viscosity determines the flow rates

options.label: B
options.text: At high flow density determines the flow rates

options.label: C
options.text: Flow is laminar at low flow rates and turbulent at high flow rates

options.label: D
options.text: Flow is turbulent at low flow rates and laminar at high flow rates

questions.correct_answer: D. Flow is turbulent at low flow rates and laminar at high flow rates
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Flow is turbulent at low flow rates and laminar at high flow rates At the base of the flow meter tube, the diameter is narrow which means the flow meter is behaving like a tube where the length is more than the As the tube is narrow, the cross-sectional area available for gas to pass around the bobbin will be less. So, eventually, flow rate will be less making the flow to become laminar At the top of the flow meter, the diameter is more which means the tube will behave like an orifice where the diameter is more than the length; the cross-sectional area around the bobbin is more therefore there will be a higher flow of gas. High flow makes the flow to become turbulent

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A- Laminar flow is determined by gas viscosity. Option B- Turbulent flow is determined by the density Option C- Flow is laminar at low flow rates and turbulent at high flow rates

Option D- The back panel consists of a fluorescent back panel so that the rotameter can be visualized in darkness too.

Semi-open circuits were described by Mapleson who divided them into 6 types: Type A (Magill circuit). Type B (no more used) Type C (also called Water's circuit) is also no more used. questions.text: Fresh gas flow in the following circuit:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Equal to minute volume It is the Magill circuit Fresh gases from the machine (shown as a continuous line in the diagram-) reaches the patient. Most of the expired gasses from the patient (broken lines) are exhaled from the pressure relief valve however some of the gases go back into the tubing (that is why these circuits are called semiopen circuits). These expiratory gasses which have gone back in the tubing may be re-inhaled by the patient in the next This is called rebreathing (patient rebreathing his/her expired gases). To prevent this rebreathing there are recommendations for fresh gas flow for each circuit; fresh gas flow should be sufficient enough to push these expiratory gases out in the atmosphere through the expiratory valve before getting delivered to the patient. For Magill circuit, fresh gas flow should be equal to minute volume to prevent rebreathing in a spontaneously breathing patient. If this circuit is used for controlled ventilation (no spontaneous breathing, the patient is on artificial ventilation) very high flows (3 times of minute volume or > 20 L) are required and in spite of such high flows prevention of rebreathing is still unpredictable therefore Magill circuit should not be used for controlled ventilation. It is the circuit of choice for spontaneous ventilation.

questions.text: Untrue about the following circuit:

options.label: C
options.text: Fresh gas flow is 1.6 times of minute volume

questions.explanation:
Solution:

None of the above The Bain circuit is the co-axial ( one tube passing through the other) modification of Type D Mapleson. Fresh gases are delivered through the inner tube so that the mixing of fresh gases and exhaled gases can be minimized therefore Bain circuit is the most commonly used semi open circuit in anesthesia.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option B - Corrugated tubing is long (1.8 meters), making it useful for head and neck surgeries where the anesthetist is away from the patient. Option C - It is the circuit of choice for controlled ventilation. Fresh gas flow for controlled ventilation is 1.6 times of minute ventilation The bain circuit is not preferred for spontaneous ventilation because the fresh gas flow requirement is higher i.e., 2.5 times of minute volume.

questions.explanation:

questions.text: The rate of flow of fresh gases through Ayre’s T piece in 1-year-old is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

6-7 liters/min The minute volume of 1-year-old child is 100 ml (tidal volume @ 10 ml/kg* 25 (the respiratory rate at 1 year) = 2.5 liters. Fresh gas flow for Ayre’s T piece is 2.5 times of minute volume i.e. 2.5 *2.5 = 6.25 liters/minute.

questions.text: The constitution of modern day soda lime is:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

80% Ca(OH)2, 3% NaOH, 2% KOH, H20 15% The composition of soda lime used in current practice is: Calcium hydroxide Ca(OH)2: 80%. Sodium hydroxide (NaOH): 3%. Potassium hydroxide (KOH): 2%. Water: 15% Color indicator Silica (to prevent dust formation).

Highyeild:

Desiccated (extremely dry) soda lime can produce dangerous complications with Sevoflurane and Desflurane. It can produce burns of the respiratory tract with Sevoflurane and carbon monoxide poisoning with Desflurane. To prevent this desiccation 15% water has been added

Extraedge:

Composition of traditional soda lime: Calcium hydroxide Ca(OH)2: 95%. Sodium hydroxide (NaOH): 3%. Potassium hydroxide (KOH): 2%. Color indicator Silica It does not have water and calcium hydroxide is 95%

questions.text: A 30-year-old female is undergoing cholecystectomy under GA with a closed circuit. The patients started to desaturate. Co-oximeter showed carboxyhemoglobin. Most probably anesthetist would have used:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Desflurane Desiccated (dry) soda lime can produce carbon monoxide mainly with desflurane but can also produce with other inhalational agents in current use. Desflurane > isoflurane >> halothane = sevoflurane

Highyeild:

Fortunately, the possibility of this complication is very rare because the possibility of soda lime getting desiccated is very rare due to the following reasons; Water is produced during the reaction of CO2 with soda lime Water constitutes 15% of the composition of soda lime

questions.text: A 36-year-old patient is undergoing laparoscopic cholecystectomy under GA with a circle system. If the expiratory valve shown in the diagram gets stuck in the closed position, it will lead to:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Barotrauma Unidirectional valves are a very important component of a circle system to ensure that there remains a unidirectional flow of gasses so that expiratory gasses do not enter the inspiratory limb and inspiratory gases do not enter the expiratory limb. However, stacking these valves either in an open or closed position can have dire consequences. If the expiratory valve gets stuck in a closed position, the patient will not be able to exhale gasses and can develop severe barotrauma.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A - Stucking of the inspiratory valve in an open position will lead the expiratory gasses to enter the inspiratory limb leading to rebreathing of expired gasses Option C - Expiratory valve if gets stuck in an open position will lead the inspiratory gasses to enter the inspiratory limb leading to hypoventilation to rebreathing. Similarly, stucking of the inspiratory valve in a closed position can cause severe hypoventilation or even non-ventilation.

questions.text: During mechanical ventilation of a patient under GA, the anesthetist finds that the patient started to desaturate, the monitor is showing that the patient is not getting adequate tidal volume, and the flow sensor is showing low pressures. Immediate management should be:

options.label: B

questions.text: A 48-year-old male is posted for emergency herniorrhaphy for an obstructed hernia. History revealed that the patient is a known case of end-stage renal disease and urea and creatinine was found to be significantly elevated. The anesthetist decided to get the surgery done under a circle system. He would like to avoid which volatile inhalational agent?
questions.explanation:
Solution:

Sevoflurane Sevoflurane should be avoided in renal compromised patients due to 2 reasons: CO2 absorbents containing catalysts (NaOH and KOH) can produce compound A with Sevoflurane which is nephrotoxic. However, the production of compound A is very rare. Among the agents of current use, sevoflurane produces the maximum fluoride.

Highyeild:

Production of compound A is so rare in clinical practice that more or less it is considered theoretical. Although sevoflurane produces maximum fluoride however clearance of fluoride is fast enough not to cause renal failure in normal patients but in renal-compromised patients this fluoride can worsen renal failure.

Random:

Explanation for incorrect options: - Option A- Desflurane is negligibly metabolized therefore is safest for renal patients Option B - Isoflurane neither produces compound A nor significant fluoride Option D- Halothane also does not produce any toxic compound with soda lime and fluoride production is also seen only in anaerobic situations.

questions.text: True about anesthesia machine: Cylinder is a part of a high-pressure system O2 flush delivers < 35 liters. O2 flush delivers> 35 liters Pipelines is a part the low pressure system Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1 and 3 are correct The yoke (the part of the machine where the cylinders get fitted) and its assemblies (cylinders, central supply pipelines) are part of the high-pressure system in the anesthesia Oxygen flush is a button in anesthesia machine which in case of emergency situations deliver oxygen at a high flow of around 35 liters/ min at a high pressure of 50-60 PSI. Based on the pressure the anesthesia machine has been divided into 3 parts High-pressure system: starts from yoke assembly up to 1 st stage pressure reducing valve Intermediate pressure system: starts from 2 nd stage pressure reducing valve to flow control knobs Low-pressure system: part of the anesthesia machine downstream to flow control knobs are low-pressure system

questions.text: Gas filled as a liquid in the cylinder in: O2 CO2 N2O Cyclopropane Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

2, 3, and 4 are correct (CO2, N2O, Cyclopropane) Nitrous oxide, carbon dioxide, and Cyclopropane are stored as liquids in cylinders

Highyeild:

A gas can be stored in liquid form below its critical temperature. The critical temperature of nitrous oxide, CO2, and cyclopropane is below room temperature. Therefore, it is possible to store these gases in liquid form in cylinders. The critical temperature of oxygen is -119C. Therefore, to store oxygen in liquid form a special reservoir is required which can maintain the temperature below -119 C. Therefore, oxygen is available in liquid form in special containers not in cylinders. In this question, if they had asked which gas can be stored in liquid form without mentioning cylinders, then the answer would have been all

Extraedge:

The content of the cylinders in gaseous form is proportional to the pressure i.e., if the oxygen cylinder is showing the pressure of 1000 PSI, means it’s half full. However, this is not applicable to gases in liquid form; even a small amount of remaining gas will produce same the Therefore, the content of these cylinders is measured by weighing these cylinders rather than by depending on the pressure gauge.

questions.text: Rebreathing systems are: To & fro system Circle system Water’s system Mapleson F Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1 and 2 are correct (To & fro system, Circle system) Rebreathing means the circuits which allow the rebreathing of expired gases after absorption of CO2. Circle systems allow the rebreathing of gases after absorption of CO2 by soda lime. To and fro was a type of closed circuit used in past for children. However, it is obsolete in a present-day Waters (Mapleson type C) and Mapleson F are semi-open circuits where all of the expired gases are exhaled into the atmosphere.

questions.text: All decreases CO2 absorption in a closed circuit: Resistance at an outlet High flow 3. Increased minute volume Channeling Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

2, 3, and 4 are correct Resistance at the outlet allows the gasses to be in contact with soda lime for prolonged periods improving the absorption High flow allows less time for the gases to remain in contact with soda lime High minute volume increases the load on soda bicarbonate thereby decreasing the absorption of carbon dioxide Channeling means gasses passing through the gap between the walls of the soda lime canister and granules without getting absorbed.

1, and 3 are correct The color of the oxygen cylinder is a black body with white shoulders Central supply of oxygen is at 60 PSI Entonox is a mixture of 50% oxygen and 50% nitrous oxide, therefore exhibit the pressure of oxygen i.e., 2000 PSI Oxygen, nitrous oxide, and air are supplied through a central supply at a pressure of 2000PSI Rotameters tubes are conical in shape; narrow at the base and wider at the apex to accommodate high flows.

The color of cylinders varies in different countries. questions.text: Which of the following statement is/are true? Anesthesia machine can accommodate more than one vaporizer Fresh gas from the machine outlet is delivered at a pressure of 5-8 PSI The minimum percentage of oxygen required in fresh gas flow is 50%- True/False The fresh gas flow required in a closed circuit is equal to the minute volume - true/false Select the correct answer from the below code:
questions.explanation:
Solution:

1 and 2 are correct Anesthesia machine can accommodate more than one vaporizer however will allow only one vaporizer to be used at one time. The final mixture coming out from the machine outlet i.e., fresh gas flow is delivered at a pressure of 5-8 PSI The fresh gas flow usually consists of 75% nitrous oxide /air+ 25% oxygen and one of the volatile agents. So, the minimum percentage of oxygen required is 25%. The fresh gas flow required in a closed circuit is very low because the same gases can be reused.

Extraedge:

As nitrous oxide is detrimental to oxygen therefore many anesthetists nowadays are using air instead of nitrous oxide.
